definition: to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
to leave in the middle of the play/(fig.) to leave before the matter is concluded

sentences.english: The player was sidelined with a sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 這運動員因踝部扭傷而退場。

sentences.english: The former scene by dinosaur was more wonderful than human's.
sentences.chinese: 剛退場的恐龍戲碼，就比我們精彩有趣得多了。

sentences.english: Whenever the batsman chopped at the ball, he hit it.
sentences.chinese: 有多少種方式使擊球手退場？

sentences.english: After that the generals began to disperse with the solemnity and circumspect taciturnity with which people separate after a funeral.
sentences.chinese: 將軍們隨即莊嚴肅穆地退場，像參加完了葬禮一樣。
我以跑動得34分被擊敗而退場。

sentences.english: The referee ordered Johnson off in the second half for kicking another player.
sentences.chinese: 在下半場約翰遜踢人犯規，裁判罰他退場。

sentences.english: The referee awarded a penalty and ordered an early bath for Sansome.
sentences.chinese: 裁判處罰了桑塞姆並令他提前退場。

sentences.english: The pitcher left the game because he injured his throwing arm.
sentences.chinese: 那位投手因爲弄傷了他投球的那蘋手臂而中途退場。

sentences.english: His withdrawal can only be construed as a protest.
sentences.chinese: 他的退場只能被理解爲是一種抗議。

sentences.english: Retired after touched an empty single, should not continue to fight.
sentences.chinese: 觸及後空單退場，不宜戀戰。

sentences.english: How many different ways may a batsman be given out?
sentences.chinese: 有多少種方式使擊球手退場？

sentences.english: After entering a winter drop in temperature the footstep is ceaseless, spit exeunts, north wind rises again.
sentences.chinese: 入冬後的降溫腳步不停，小雨退場，北風又起。

sentences.english: I will stick to the world after you exit the moment faded.
sentences.chinese: 我也會堅持到你退場後全世界黯淡下來的那一刻。

sentences.english: The first batsman was bowled out.
sentences.chinese: 頭一個擊球員被迫退場了。

sentences.english: After the loss, Wang met with pitching coach Ron Guidry.
sentences.chinese: 在失分退場後，幫主和投手教練古大叔交談了一下。

definition: crisis/CL:個|个[ge4]
to worry/anxiety (about)
to worry/to be concerned
end/conclusion/to come to an end/to terminate (sth)
to stop/to terminate (law)
to turn back/to reverse
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to be bound to/undoubtedly will
to foresee/to predict/to forecast/to envision/foresight/intuition/vision
the end/an ending/to wind down/to conclude
(of a check etc) to cash/to honor a commitment
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
final/ultimate
temporary/provisional/for the time being
to withdraw from/to evacuate
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
